column4: can someone tell me whats going on here: http://dsfdsf3.pastebin.com/d7e604ae9 i need help
Does the file /etc/passwd.lock exist?
yes
Is there any output from "sudo fuser /etc/passwd.lock" ?
no
Do you use the guest session feature?
rarely
You might have hit this bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/shadow/+bug/432964
i don't understand though, this will cause firefox to segfault, and break dpkg?
Just to be completely sure nothing legitimately has a lock on /etc/passwd I would reboot, then if they are still there delete /etc/passwd.lock and /etc/shadow.lock
yes i rebooted a few times
so i should just delete those files?
Shouldn't cause firefox to segfault but that is what is causing the problem with dpkg
Yes
ok i will delete
Wait
i believe dpkg failed in updating firefox, and that is causing the segfault
Just rename them, accidentally mistyping and deleting /etc/passwd would be disasterous
ok
should i restart?
No need ( unless the package manager is asking you to )
thanks, that may have worked
np
i think firefox just is installed incorrectly now
